data.question: What is the coordination geometry of the zinc(II) complex synthesized with an N,N-chelating nopinane-annelated 4,5-diazafluoren-9-one ligand?
How does the coordination geometry of the cadmium(II) complex differ from its zinc(II) counterpart when synthesized with the same ligand?
data.answer: The cadmium(II) complex features an octahedral CdN2Cl4 coordination geometry and forms a 1D polymeric structure due to the bridging coordination of chlorido ligands.

data.question: What effect does the introduction of an oxygen atom in the ligand core have on the luminescence of the complexes?
data.answer: The introduction of the oxygen atom results in a drastic red-shift of the emission band due to short-range charge transfer, leading to an order of magnitude larger Stokes shifts.

data.question: What behavior do LO and its complexes exhibit when transitioning from solution to the solid state, according to photoluminescence quantum yields?
data.answer: LO and its complexes exhibit aggregation-induced emission (AIE) behavior with photoluminescence quantum yields reaching tens of percent.

data.question: True or False: The zinc(II) and cadmium(II) complexes with the oxygen-free 4,5-diazafluorene ligand exhibit larger Stokes shifts compared to their oxygen-containing counterparts.
What is the impact of the oxygen atom in the ligand core on the differences between the S0 and S1 geometries of the ligands and complexes?
data.answer: The presence of the oxygen atom in the ligand core makes the differences between the S0 and S1 geometries much more pronounced for LO and LO-based compounds than those of their oxygen-free analogues, leading to larger Stokes shifts.

data.question: True or False: The zinc(II) complex with the nopinane-annelated 4,5-diazafluoren-9-one ligand forms a 1D polymeric structure.
What experimental techniques were used to study the photophysical properties of the oxygen-containing LO ligand and its complexes?
data.answer: Comprehensive experimental and theoretical studies, including photoluminescence quantum yield measurements and density functional theory (DFT) calculations.

data.question: True or False: The cadmium(II) complex with the nopinane-annelated 4,5-diazafluoren-9-one ligand adopts a mononuclear structure similar to its zinc(II) counterpart.
How does the emission of the complexes change when going from solution to the solid state?
data.answer: In the solid state, the complexes exhibit aggregation-induced emission (AIE) behavior, with photoluminescence quantum yields significantly increasing compared to their values in solution.
